result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn T Strahota was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to make a list of everyone that he is associated with and go over with agent and see who he can have contact with and who he may not.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
3:09 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with probation and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-No Contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to make a list of everyone that he is associated with and go over with agent and see who he can have contact with and who he may not.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 3:17 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:51 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has no offer and defendant requests to talk with her again.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 10, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:52 p.m.

10:16 A.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - still waiting for Discovery.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 5, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:17 a.m.

No Contact with Justin C.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.

No Contact with Justin C.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

1:11 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Justin C.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court will set for internal review in 30 days .

Court adjourned at 1:12 p.m.
